description: Model for file on the AMP-ALS portal - union of clinical and omic file types

alternateName.description: An alternate name that can be used for search and discovery improvement.
alternateName.title: Alternate Name

analysisTypes.description: Computational and statistical analysis methods applied to the data
analysisTypes.title: Analysis Types

annotations.description: Types of biological databases and annotations referenced in this file
annotations.title: Biological Annotations

assay.description: What's used to generate data in file, typically referring to the assay. Omit if not applicable.
assay.title: Measurement Technique

biospecimenType.description: Type of biological specimen(s) in the file.
biospecimenType.title: Biospecimen Type

cellType.description: Type of cell or cell line used in the file.
cellType.title: Cell Type

citation.description: identifies academic articles that are recommended by the data provider be cited in addition to the file itself.
citation.title: Citation

clinicalDomain.description: The primary clinical domain or area of focus for the data
clinicalDomain.title: Clinical Domain

contributor.description: Institution or person responsible for collecting and managing the files and records in the file.
contributor.title: Contributor(s)

creator.description: Properly formatted name of the organization or person that is creator of the file (e.g. "Sage Bionetworks" or "John Doe"), not an id. Most preferred is the project PI or data lead who's responsible for its conception and initial content creation.
creator.title: Creator

dataType.description: Reflects the data types within the file.
dataType.title: Data Type

description.description: Blurb for the file; should be no more than 500 characters.
description.title: Description

disease.description: Disease(s) or condition(s) studied in the file.
disease.title: Disease

includedInDataCatalog.description: Link(s) to known data catalog(s) the file is included in.
includedInDataCatalog.title: Included In Data Catalog

individualCount.description: Number of unique individuals included in the file (whether as individual-level or as aggregate data). Omit if not applicable/unknown.
individualCount.title: Individual Count

libraryLayout.description: Single-end or paired-end sequencing layout for files containing sequencing data.
libraryLayout.title: Library Layout

license.description: Unless information for license is clear, this should default to UNKNOWN.
license.title: License

originalSampleName.description: Original sample name from data source
originalSampleName.title: Original Sample Name

publisher.description: Name of the organization or person responsible for making the file available.
publisher.title: Publisher

sameAs.description: Another platform's URI or compact URI for this same resource. See https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-ref/#sameAs-def.
sameAs.title: Same As

source.description: Host platform from which the file was sourced.
source.title: Source

species.description: Species of the organism(s) from which the data were generated. Omit property if not applicable, such as for data like compounds or other non-biological data.
species.title: Species

studyPhase.description: Phase or stage of the clinical study when file was generated
studyPhase.title: Study Phase

subject.description: Applicable subject term(s) for file cataloging; use the Library of Congress Subject Headings (LCSH) scheme.
subject.title: Subject

url.description: URL for the original file location at source.
url.title: URL

visitType.description: Type of clinical visit (baseline, follow-up, etc.)
visitType.title: Visit Type

title: File
